title: CompTIA to Share Insights on State of the IT Channel at Channel Directions Live
text:
[September 23, 2015] CompTIA to Share Insights on State of the IT Channel at Channel Directions Live 
DOWNERS GROVE, Ill. , Sept. 23, 2015 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- Insights on new business models, emerging technologies, evolving customer and vendor relationships and other factors impacting information technology (IT) companies will be offered by senior researchers from CompTIA , the IT industry association, at Channel Directions Live in Tampa, Fla. , Sept. 28-30 . 
Carolyn April , senior director for industry analysis, and Seth Robinson , senior director for technology analysis, are scheduled to speak at a Channel Directions Live exclusive session titled "What It All Means" at 8:30 a.m. (EDT) on Wednesday, Sept. 30 . 
With five years of comprehensive research and trending data on the IT channel, CompTIA is well positioned to lead a detailed discussion on channel alliances, technology directions, business strategies and customer relationships. 
"Channel partners remain a vital linchpin in this process of getting technology solutions into the hands of customers," April said. "But their role is evolving as routes to market become more diverse and the field of competitors grows more crowded. We'll examine the factors behind this shift and provide some prescriptive advice on ways channel firms can retool their business models and customer acquisition strategies." 
Much of this marketplace dynamism is driven by the widespread availability of cloud-based and mobile technology solutions. With technology more accessible and available to more users, organizations are changing their approaches and processes for choosing, implementing and managing IT. 
"For example, many departments besides IT – individual business units, finance, marketing, sales and human resources – are more engaged in the discussions and decisions on technology purchases," Robinson noted. "This change doesn't eliminate the need for channel partners, but it does alter the manner in which channel partners engage with existing and prospective customers." 
Complete presentation slides will be posted on CompTIA's SlideShare account ( http://www.slideshare.net/comptia ) following the live program. 
Channel Directions Live is a new event designed for partners to address the changing business dynamics of the IT channel head on. Leaders from across the channel will come together to tackle the tough business challenges of today and map out the future direction of the industry. Visit http://channeldirections.com/ to learn more and follow at #CDLive2015. 
About CompTIA The Computing Technology Industry Association (CompTIA) is a non-profit trade association serving as the voice of the information technology industry. With approximately 2,000 member companies, 55,000 registered users, 3,000 academic and training partners and more than two million IT certifications issued, CompTIA is dedicated to advancing industry growth through educational programs, market research, networking events, professional certifications and public policy advocacy. To learn more, visit CompTIA online , Facebook , LinkedIn and Twitter .
